text: Why are you here?
She’s been irritable and started saying her right hip hurts.
So what brought you in today with Charity?
I’m sorry, I had trouble understanding you. Could you please rephrase that?
When did this start?
She’s been more fussy for about five days, and she first pointed to her right hip and said it hurt maybe two or three days ago.
Stop for a second.
Okay. Is there something you want to ask or clarify about Charity?
When did the fever start?
I’m sorry, I had trouble understanding you. Could you please rephrase that?
How long has she had a fever?
I’m sorry, I had trouble understanding you. Could you please rephrase that?
Has anything helped?
Ibuprofen seems to help with her pain and fever for a little while, but it doesn’t last long. She still acts tired and quiet even after taking it.
On a scale of 1 to 10, how painful is it?
It’s hard to say exactly since she’s only three, but when it’s bad she cries and won’t put any weight on her leg. I’d guess maybe a 7 or 8 for her, especially when she tries to walk.
On a scale of 1 to 10, how—?
I’m sorry, I had trouble understanding you. Could you please rephrase that?
Is the hip pain constant?
It comes and goes. She says it hurts more when she tries to walk or put weight on it, but sometimes she’ll sit quietly and not mention it.
How? Where were you at when the pain started?
We were at home when she first pointed to her right hip and said it hurt. She was just playing quietly in the living room, nothing unusual happened right before.
Any recent trauma or injuries?
No, there hasn’t been any recent trauma or injuries. She didn’t fall or hurt herself before all this started.
Any complications during pregnancy?
No, my pregnancy with her was uncomplicated. Everything went smoothly.
Did she have a normal birth history?
Yes, her birth was normal. No complications, and she came home with us right away.
Has Charity ever had any past surgeries?
No, Charity has never had any surgeries.
Did you ever have any past surgeries?
I’m fine, really. Let’s just talk about Charity.
Any allergies?
No, she doesn’t have any known allergies.
Do you have any medications?
She’s only had ibuprofen for pain and fever as needed. No other medications.
Has she met her developmental milestones?
Yes, she’s met all her milestones on time—walking, talking, playing, everything. There haven’t been any concerns about her development.
What past medical illnesses has she had?
She’s never had any major illnesses. Her development’s been normal, and she’s up-to-date on all her shots. She’s usually very healthy.
Sweet girl.
She really is. I just want her to feel better and get back to her normal self. Is there anything else you need to know about Charity?
Is she well behaved?
Yes, she’s usually very well behaved—gentle and curious, loves playing and helping with her baby sister. Lately, though, she’s been more fussy and quiet than usual.
Have there been any recent injuries?
No, there haven’t been any injuries. She didn’t fall or bump into anything that I know of. This just started out of nowhere.
Is she experiencing pain anywhere else?
No, she only complains about her right hip. She hasn’t mentioned pain anywhere else.
Does she have any siblings or family members who experience something similar?
No, her baby sister is fine, and nobody else in the family has had anything like this. It’s just Charity who’s been having these problems.
Umm, has she ever had anything like this before?
No, she’s never had anything like this before. She’s usually healthy and active, and nothing similar has ever happened.
Has she been in contact with anyone else that has been sick?
Not that I know of. No one at home has been sick, and I haven’t heard about any illnesses at her preschool either.
Has she been sick recently?
No, she hasn’t been sick recently. No colds or anything like that before all this started.
